DOC.brief_summary: A multicenter study to evaluate the safety and efficacy of ezetimibe/simvastatin versus atorvastatin in elderly patients with high cholesterol at high or moderately high risk for coronary heart disease.
DOC.brief_title: A Study to Assess the Cholesterol Lowering Effect of Ezetimibe/Simvastatin Combination Tablet Compared to Another Cholesterol Lowering Drug in Elderly Patients With High Cholesterol at High or Moderately High Risk for Coronary Heart Disease (0653A-128)
DOC.criteria: Patient has a cholesterol level of 130 mg/dL or greater Patient is willing to maintain a cholesterol lowering diet for as long as they are in the study Patient is at moderate high risk or high risk for coronary heart disease per the National Cholesterol Education Program Adult Treatment Panel III (NCEP ATPIII) guidelines Patient weighs less than 100 lbs Patient has an allergy to ezetimibe, simvastatin or atorvastatin
